messages.subject: Re: [SHQ] Tidbits
messages.msgSnippet: Foudn the TV series for sale....but the price...OUCH ... From: Barbara Sheridan To: SHQ@yahoogroups.com Sent: Monday, April 05, 2004 6:19 PM Subject: Re: [SHQ]
messages.messageBody:
Foudn the TV series for sale....but the price...OUCH

----- Original Message -----
From: Barbara Sheridan
To: SHQ@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Monday, April 05, 2004 6:19 PM
Subject: Re: [SHQ] Tidbits




Tiffany wrote:

>1) Before Mibugishiden was turned into a film for the big screen it
>was a TV-series starring Ken Watanabe (LAST SAMURAI) as Yoshimura
>Kanichiro
>Official site (you must babelfish it)...took me forever to find it
>http://www.tv-tokyo.co.jp/mibugishiden/
>***the guy who portrays Saitou Hajime in the TV-series was in SHALL WE
>DANCE...>>
>

I have a headache so I'll wait till tomorrow to check this out,
babelfish would kill me for sure tonight *grin*

>2) NHK Taiga Drama Shinsengumi is at a point where the story is
>concentrating on Serizawa Kamo.>>
>
The episode last night (#13, I believe) was so good--So good that you
could understand 90% of what was going on even though you couldn't
understand a word they said. It was about Kondou facing off against
Serizawa as the Roushigumi headed from Edo to Kyoto and Serizawa was not
given proper accommodations.

If you aren't a fan of the actor playing serizawa (Koichi Sato who was
Saitou in Mibugishiden) you will be after seeing this performance. That
man can convey what would be lines and lines of dialogue with a few
facial expressions. I'm not at all surprised he won an award for his
Saitou portrayal..

>3) http://www.saitou-hajime.com or http://www.saito-hajime.com is
>CLOSING :(
>
>
>
Why are they closing down? I didn't see any specifics on the site.

--
Barbara Sheridan
http://www.barbarasheridan.net



[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

babelfish would kill me for sure tonight *grin*

>2) NHK Taiga Drama Shinsengumi is at a point where the story is
>concentrating on Serizawa Kamo.>>

The episode last night (#13, I believe) was so good--So good that you
could understand 90% of what was going on even though you couldn't
understand a word they said. It was about Kondou facing off against
Serizawa as the Roushigumi headed from Edo to Kyoto and Serizawa was not

If you aren't a fan of the actor playing serizawa (Koichi Sato who was

facial expressions. I'm not at all surprised he won an award for his

messages.subject: Tidbits
messages.msgSnippet: 1) Before Mibugishiden was turned into a film for the big screen it was a TV-series starring Ken Watanabe (LAST SAMURAI) as Yoshimura Kanichiro Official site
messages.messageBody:
1) Before Mibugishiden was turned into a film for the big screen it
was a TV-series starring Ken Watanabe (LAST SAMURAI) as Yoshimura
Kanichiro
Official site (you must babelfish it)...took me forever to find it
http://www.tv-tokyo.co.jp/mibugishiden/
***the guy who portrays Saitou Hajime in the TV-series was in SHALL WE
DANCE...

2) NHK Taiga Drama Shinsengumi is at a point where the story is
concentrating on Serizawa Kamo

3) http://www.saitou-hajime.com or http://www.saito-hajime.com is
CLOSING :(
